action.action-desc: Mr. Emmer introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide for the indexing of certain assets for purposes of determining gain or loss of eligible individuals.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Retirement Inflation Protection Act of 2017.

section.header: Indexing of certain assets for purposes of determining gain or loss of eligible individuals

subsection.text: Part II of subchapter O of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by redesignating section 1023 as section 1024 and by inserting after section 1022 the following new section:

section.header: Indexing of certain assets for purposes of determining gain or loss of eligible individuals

paragraph.header: Indexed basis substituted for adjusted basis
paragraph.text: Solely for purposes of determining gain or loss on the sale or other disposition by an eligible individual of an indexed asset which has been held by such individual for more than 3 years, the indexed basis of the asset shall be substituted for its adjusted basis.
The deductions for depreciation, depletion, and amortization shall be determined without regard to the application of paragraph (1) to the taxpayer or any other person.
Paragraph (1) shall apply only with respect to indexed assets for which the taxpayer has written documentation of the original purchase price paid or incurred by the taxpayer to acquire such asset.

subsection.text: For purposes of this section, the term eligible individual means, with respect to any indexed asset, any individual if such individual has attained age 591/2 as of the date of the sale or other disposition of such asset.

paragraph.text: For purposes of this section, the term indexed asset means—

subparagraph.text: common stock in a C corporation (other than a foreign corporation), or

paragraph.continuation-text: which is a capital asset or property used in the trade or business (as defined in section 1231(b)).

paragraph.header: Stock in certain foreign corporations included

subparagraph.text: The term indexed asset includes common stock in a foreign corporation which is regularly traded on an established securities market.

clause.text: stock of a foreign investment company,
stock in a passive foreign investment company (as defined in section 1296),
stock in a foreign corporation held by a United States person who meets the requirements of section 1248(a)(2), and
stock in a foreign personal holding company.

subparagraph.text: An American depository receipt for common stock in a foreign corporation shall be treated as common stock in such corporation.

paragraph.text: The indexed basis for any asset is—

subparagraph.text: the adjusted basis of the asset, increased by

paragraph.text: The applicable inflation adjustment for any asset is an amount equal to—

subparagraph.text: the adjusted basis of the asset, multiplied by

clause.text: the gross domestic product deflator for the last calendar quarter ending before the asset is disposed of, exceeds
the gross domestic product deflator for the last calendar quarter ending before the asset was acquired by the taxpayer.

paragraph.continuation-text: The percentage under subparagraph (B) shall be rounded to the nearest 1/10 of 1 percentage point.

paragraph.text: The gross domestic product deflator for any calendar quarter is the implicit price deflator for the gross domestic product for such quarter (as shown in the last revision thereof released by the Secretary of Commerce before the close of the following calendar quarter).

subsection.header: Suspension of holding period where diminished risk of loss; treatment of short sales

paragraph.text: If the taxpayer (or a related person) enters into any transaction which substantially reduces the risk of loss from holding any asset, such asset shall not be treated as an indexed asset for the period of such reduced risk.

subparagraph.text: In the case of a short sale of an indexed asset with a short sale period in excess of 3 years, for purposes of this title, the amount realized shall be an amount equal to the amount realized (determined without regard to this paragraph) increased by the applicable inflation adjustment. In applying subsection (d)(2) for purposes of the preceding sentence, the date on which the property is sold short shall be treated as the date of acquisition and the closing date for the sale shall be treated as the date of disposition.
For purposes of subparagraph (A), the short sale period begins on the day that the property is sold and ends on the closing date for the sale.

paragraph.text: This section shall not apply to any sale or other disposition of property between related persons except to the extent that the basis of such property in the hands of the transferee is a substituted basis.
For purposes of this section, the term related persons means—

subparagraph.text: persons bearing a relationship set forth in section 267(b), and
persons treated as single employer under subsection (b) or (c) of section 414.

subsection.text: If any person transfers cash, debt, or any other property to another person and the principal purpose of such transfer is to secure or increase an adjustment under subsection (a), the Secretary may disallow part or all of such adjustment or increase.

paragraph.text: If there is an addition to the adjusted basis of any tangible property or of any stock in a corporation during the taxable year by reason of an improvement to such property or a contribution to capital of such corporation—

subparagraph.text: such addition shall never be taken into account under subsection (d)(1)(A) if the aggregate amount thereof during the taxable year with respect to such property or stock is less than $1,000, and

such addition shall be treated as a separate asset acquired at the close of such taxable year if the aggregate amount thereof during the taxable year with respect to such property or stock is $1,000 or more.

paragraph.continuation-text: A rule similar to the rule of the preceding sentence shall apply to any other portion of an asset to the extent that separate treatment of such portion is appropriate to carry out the purposes of this section.

paragraph.header: Assets which are not indexed assets throughout holding period
paragraph.text: The applicable inflation adjustment shall be appropriately reduced for periods during which the asset was not an indexed asset.
A distribution with respect to stock in a corporation which is not a dividend shall be treated as a disposition.

To the extent that (but for this paragraph) this section would create or increase a net ordinary loss to which section 1231(a)(2) applies or an ordinary loss to which any other provision of this title applies, such provision shall not apply. The taxpayer shall be treated as having a long-term capital loss in an amount equal to the amount of the ordinary loss to which the preceding sentence applies.

paragraph.header: Acquisition date where there has been prior application of subsection (a)(1) with respect to the taxpayer
paragraph.text: If there has been a prior application of subsection (a)(1) to an asset while such asset was held by the taxpayer, the date of acquisition of such asset by the taxpayer shall be treated as not earlier than the date of the most recent such prior application.

subsection.text: The Secretary shall prescribe such regulations as may be necessary or appropriate to carry out the purposes of this section.

The table of sections for part II of subchapter O of chapter 1 of such Code is amended by striking the item relating to section 1023 and by inserting after the item relating to section 1022 the following new items:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 1022. Indexing of certain assets for purposes of determining gain or loss.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to indexed assets acquired by the taxpayer after December 31, 2017, in taxable years ending after such date.
